main_definition: Champions are people or entities recognized as the best in a particular field, sport, activity, or cause.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals who excel in sports and win competitions
meanings_and_examples.example: Michael Jordan was considered one of the greatest basketball champions of all time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People who are leaders or advocates for a cause, social movement, or organization
meanings_and_examples.example: The champions of climate change action push governments and corporations to take immediate steps against global warming.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals who have achieved great success in their careers, academics, or any other professional field
meanings_and_examples.example: Steve Jobs was a champion of innovation and technology advancements that changed the world.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Entities or organizations recognized for outstanding performance or achievement
meanings_and_examples.example: Tesla, Inc. is considered a champion in the electric vehicle industry with its revolutionary products and business model.
